alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 6:28AM EST until February 18 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecasted. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands and fields begin along the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County...to Alpharetta and Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding starts to effect portions of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may become closed with around one foot of water...especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 7.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
